name: [ENG] Mind HK x DOTS - a solo play by Annie Cheung 香港心聆 x 《想・點》——張雅麗獨腳戲綵排表演
location: 藝穗會 The Fringe Club, 2 下亞厘畢道 Jockey Club Studio 中環, HKI
about: Annie Cheung, actress and playwright of the solo performance DOTS, is offering an open dress rehearsal performance of DOTS before its formal run at the Edinburgh Fringe in August this year.As a form of self-exploration and revelation, this performance creates a space for conversations about mental health and resilience. Amy Hung, expressive arts therapist and drama educator, will join Annie in the post-show sharing session to discuss the concepts and messages behind the performance.As a Mental Health Ambassador at Mind HK, Annie shares her mental health recovery journey with the community. Join us in watching her performance, and let’s talk about mental health to normalise and destigmatise it!This event is organised by Mind HK’s More Than a Label anti-stigma campaign. More Than a Label is glad to have MINDSET (the Jardine Matheson Group Charity) as our partner and sponsor, as well as Manulife as our sponsor for this anti-stigma programme, to support our continuous effort in destigmatising mental health.《想・點》是由張雅麗（Annie Cheung）創作和演出的獨腳戲。這次，Annie 將會在八月 Edinburgh Fringe 正式表演前，開放公開綵排給我們欣賞。作爲自己探索和揭示的媒介，這場表演將締造一個談論精神健康和復元和空間。表達藝術治療師和戲劇教育者 Amy Hung 亦會在表演後，與 Annie 一起分享戲劇表演背後的概念和訊息。作爲心聆大使，Annie 亦與觀眾分享她的精神健康復元旅程。與我們一起觀賞她的表演，參與我們爲精神健康去污名化的努力吧！感謝思健（怡和集團旗下慈善機構）為「我就是我」的長期合作伙伴及贊助商，及宏利 @manulife_hongkong 的慷慨贊助，令我們可以持續致力去除精神健康污名。Event details 活動詳情Date 日期: 24 July 2025 (Thursday) 2025年7月24日（星期四）Time 時間: 7:30PM – 9:00PM (7:30PM-7:45PM Registration 入場, 7:45PM – 8:30PM Annie’s performance 獨腳戲表演, 8:30PM – 9:00PM Post-show sharing with Annie and Amy Hung 分享環節)Venue 地點: The Jockey Club Studio Theatre, Fringe Club 藝穗會賽馬會劇場Format 模式: Open dress rehearsal and post-show sharing 公開綵排及分享環節Performer 表演者: Annie Cheung 張雅麗Guests 嘉賓: Amy Hung 洪美芝Language 語言: Performance in English, bilingual post-show sharing 英語演出，雙語分享環節Ticket 費用: Free of charge 免費*This performance is suitable for audiences aged 14 and above*此表演適合 14 歲或以上人士觀賞*Content warning: this performance discusses themes such as suicide, sex and depression with occasional use of foul language, and may be upsetting for some people.*內容警告：此表演內容討論自殺、性、抑鬱等議題，並包含粗俗語言，可能對觀眾造成不安，敬請留意。About DOTS 關於《想點》About DOTS“Only the fearless embrace their weakness—and call it strength.”DOTS, a solo play written and performed by Annie was staged in London twice with 5-star reviews. Since then, the show has gone places, in person or offline, before and during COVID-19: New York, Singapore, Vancouver, and Hong Kong. Nominated for IATCHK Performer of the Year and HK Theatre Libre Outstanding Lead Actress, Annie masterfully blends tragedy and comedy in DOTS, a critically acclaimed solo performance that lays bare the struggles of a high-achieving, yet insecure mind.Rooted in self-revelatory performance—a genre pioneered by renowned drama therapy scholar Professor Renée Emunah, DOTS is a unique solo performance merging therapy and theatre.「真正無懼，就能擁抱脆弱， 甚至將弱點變為力量。」Annie於倫敦期間，兩度上演自編丶自導丶自演的首個英語獨腳戲DOTS，大獲五星好評。此劇後來於COVID期間獲邀參與紐約及新加坡的線上戲劇節，並於2022年於溫哥華及香港演出英語與粵語版本。2023年Annie憑《想·點》（DOTS廣東話版）獲提名IATC(HK)劇評人奬年度演員獎及香港小劇場奬最佳女主角。這是一個不停遊走於悲劇與喜劇之間的女生獨腳戲，Annie勇敢丶赤裸丶幽默地向觀眾呈現她的高成就但極不安的情感世界。《想 · 點》是一個自我揭示演出，由著名美國戲劇治療學者與先鋒Professor Renée Emunah所建立，是一個結合治療與劇場的獨特劇種。About Annie Cheung 關於張雅麗Annie is an actress, a singer-songwriter and a playwright. Currently an Associate Professor of Practice at the Academy of Film, Hong Kong Baptist University.Nominated for Hong Kong Drama Awards Best Musical Lead Actress and Best Supporting Actress (Tragedy/Drama), IATCHK Performer of the Year, and twice nominated for HK Theatre Libre Outstanding Lead Actress. Graduated with an MA (distinction) and a full scholarship from Mountview Academy of Theatre Arts.Recently in June, she performed a concert version of her solo cabaret LI(N)ES 2.0 at West Kowloon Cabaret Nights with great success. She adapted a Spanish classic play YERMA into a radical, modern Cantonese version named 《妻迷》 which has just been staged in Hong Kong with extremely rave reviews.香港女演員/唱作歌手/編劇，現任香港浸會大學電影學院專業應用副教授。畢業後不久憑《聖訴》（Doubt: A Parable）母親一角﹙Mrs. Muller﹚獲提名第二十二屆香港舞台劇獎最佳女配角﹙悲劇／正劇﹚。2017年獲獎學金於倫敦著名戲劇學府Mountview Academy of Theatre Arts修讀表演碩士課程，並以優異成績畢業。2023年憑《想·點》（DOTS廣東話版）獲提名IATC(HK)劇評人奬年度演員獎及香港小劇場奬最佳女主角。2024年於香港上演第二部原創獨腳戲《跣》LI(N)ES，以歌廳（Cabaret）形式演出其一手包辦的十三首原創曲詞，分享人生路上「跣親」及重生的經歷，並憑此劇獲提名第三十三屆香港舞台劇獎最佳音樂劇女主角及香港小劇場奬最佳女主角。今年六月聯同著名音樂家朱肇階及樂隊成員，獲邀參與「西九夜延場」，於西九戲曲中心茶館劇場上演《跣》 2.0 （音樂會版），演出再次獲得高度評價。剛上演的《妻迷》，是Annie最新的編劇作品，改編自西班牙著名劇作家羅卡的經典劇作YERMA，好評如潮。What the audience said 觀眾回饋'This dark, autobiographical piece of theatre is brutally honest, extremely relatable and full of humour' **** (NorthWestEnd.co.uk).'Beautiful, raw and real. Taps into universal human feelings and experiences whilst being courageously personal' ***** (StageDoorApp.com).‘What a beautiful performance! Congratulations Annie !! It’s very touching and I really appreciate her hard work and bravery ,opening up her deep pain and emotion to the audience . I can see the power of story telling， praising the strength of honesty as an artist ! I am so happy to see this lovely woman grounded now, transforming and shining as a good actress on stage ! Hope more people can watch the show and hopefully it will have rerun in the future!’ - 甄詠蓓真摯、坦率、誠懇、勇敢—— 我覺得是每一位從事藝術工作的人必備之條件。我不知道這個世界上總共有多少人看過「DOTS 想。點」，我興幸我是其中之一。這獨腳戲是一場精彩的表演，但我認為更是一趟慘痛的刮骨療傷。「希望這個戲有一條好命！」- 蘇玉華About Amy Hung 關於洪美芝Dedicated to working with children, adolescents, and juvenile offenders, Amy completed the Alternative Training Program by the North American Drama Therapy Association. She holds a Master’s degree in Expressive Arts Therapy from the University of Hong Kong and a Master’s degree in Counseling from Hong Kong Baptist University, along with Associate Teaching Diplomas (Distinction) in Speech and Drama from Trinity College London. Amy completed her Self-Revelatory Performance in March 2025. Primarily focused on providing drama therapy and expressive arts services to NGOs and schools, Amy also offers training and supervision for professionals in the field. In addition to her clinical work, she serves as a drama critic and drama educator, specializing in teaching creative drama.IG @theyouthflowAmy致力於與兒童、青少年及青少年罪犯工作，完成了北美戲劇治療協會的替代課程。她擁有香港大學的表達藝術治療碩士學位、香港浸會大學的輔導碩士學位及倫敦聖三一學院的語言及戲劇教學文憑（優異）。Amy於2025年3月完成了她的自我剖白演出。她近年主要為非政府組織和學校提供戲劇治療和表達藝術治療服務，同時也為社工提供培訓和指導。除了臨床工作外，她還擔任戲劇評論及戲劇教育工作，專門教授創意戲劇。IG @theyouthflow

name: Sammy Obeid: Catch Me in Hong Kong!
location: The Wanch, 90 Jaffe Road #1/F Wan Chai, HKI
about: 🎤✨ Get ready for an unforgettable evening as Sammy Obeid takes the stage with his one-of-a-kind energy and razor-sharp wit! His unique take on life, math, and everything in between is comedy like you’ve never heard before.As part of his Domestic Tourist tour, Sammy touches down at The Wanch—Hong Kong’s oldest live music bar and the perfect spot to catch him riffing on jet lag, cultural chaos, and the absurd logic of everyday life. Whether you’re local or just passing through, don’t miss this rare chance to see a rising comedic voice connect the world—one punchline at a time.Doors 6:30pm | Show 7:00pm*IMPORTANT: Please note this show will be in English AND you don’t need a PayPal account to check out, if you’re on the computer, you can check out as a guest*Having issues using PayPal? Click here for troubleshooting instructions: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1l5rCboWZX0cQLlvIzYVKoD70saoL2Fpp/view?usp=sharingLebanese-Palestinian American, born in Oakland California, Sammy Obeid, double majored in Business and Mathematics at UC Berkeley and then turned down a job at Google to be a comedian. Now the host of 100 Humans on Netflix, he’s also appeared on NBC's Last Comic Standing and America's Got Talent, as well as TBS’s Conan, and is best known for his world record of performing comedy 1,001 nights in a row, a story featured in both Time Magazine and The New York Times.

name: What the cello says 提琴說
location: Sky Music Studio, 133號 海濱道 #10樓E室 Hong Kong, HKI
about: What the cello says 提琴說Come join us at Sky Music Studio for an evening filled with the enchanting sounds of the cello, where we explore the intricate and fascinating relationship between music and mental health! This event is sure to take you on a journey lead by our talented musicians that captivates you ears and soul, and leaves you feeling inspired and moved. Listening to pieces created by iconic composers and artist such as Dvorak, Mendelssohn, Sibelius, Coldplay and more, feel free to immerse yourselves in the rich tones and melodies unique to the cello. Whether you're a long-time fan or a newcomer, this is an unique opportunity to experience the beauty of the cello up close and personal which is certainly not to be missed! We look forward to meeting you!來 Sky Music Studio 與JAWS大提琴四重奏共度一個充滿迷人音色的夜晚，探索音樂與心理健康之間錯綜複雜的關係吧！這場活動將由我們才華洋溢的音樂家牽領，在旅程上俘虜您的聽覺和心靈，帶給您啟發和感動。聆聽 Dvorak, Mendelssohn、Sibelius、 Coldplay 等世界著名作曲家和藝人創作的樂曲，盡情沉浸在大提琴獨有的豐富音色和旋律之中。無論您是忠實粉絲還是初次接觸大提琴音樂，這都是一個近距離體驗大提琴之美的獨特機會，絕對不容錯過！我們期待您的到來！

name: The Gift of Stage Presence: Back and better than ever!
location: Stage Ground, Benon Tower 10/F, 266 Des Voeux Road West Sai Ying Pun, HKI
about: Hey there! Are you a fan of improv? Do you wish to become a more confident performer? Well, I’m glad you’re here!Join me, Sarah, one of the funny friends over at Rooftop Improv for a workshop all about stage presence and performing with confidence. Round one was so successful, I just HAD to come back for more!In this workshop, we will explore improv through an actor lens, break down the details of certain moments in a scene, and really get into how to hop on stage and rock a scene under pressure.Oh, you've been here before? GREAT! Come back. :) Improv is always new and different, and I know you more now as a performer, so I know how you can level up! Whether it's your first workshop or you've been before and can't get enough, I'm happy to have you.ABOUT THE HOSTSarah Wun is an educator, writer, filmmaker, dancer, puppeteer, improviser, and award-winning actress. She has taught all kinds of theatre, choreographed dance and stage combat for school plays, and directed a school play turned film during Covid in early 2020. She’s a legend when it comes to adaptation and thinking on the spot. Her acting stage credits include The Picture of Dorian Gray (2025), Time Flies (2024), and Robinhood the Panto (2023).Sarah has written three screenplays: Best Smile in the World (2022), Forward (2023) - featuring a familiar face from Rooftop!, and Remnants (2024). She has also acted in several short films, and two feature films. Sarah is currently cowriting a dark comedy TV show about growing up with a facial difference.Sarah has been a part of Rooftop Improv for four years. In that time, Rooftop has taken part in an international festival, done several workshops, and hosted loads of performances in Hong Kong.Sarah currently works as a principal artist at Treasure Chest Theatre and is constantly using her improv skills, whether it’s as a puppet or teaching dance. She teaches another form of stage presence at her Burlesque classes where she focuses on promoting self confidence through body awareness and rhythm. When she’s not performing or teaching or writing, she can be found spinning upside down on an aerial hoop or silk. Essentially, Sarah is ALWAYS performing.Sarah has taught improv to children and adults in school settings, and led team building activities in work environments. Sarah is eager - once again!!! - to bring her various performance skills AND feedback from previous participants (thank you) to this workshop!

name: Triple Headliner Comedy Night: Vivek Mahbubani, Vanessa Wang, & Harsh Jha
location: The Aftermath, 57-59 Wyndham Street Hong Kong, HKI
about: Vivek Mahbubani is a Hong Kong-bred bilingual stand-up comedian performing in both Cantonese and English. Having been crowned the Funniest Person (in Chinese) in Hong Kong in 2007 followed by his victory in the English category at the Hong Kong International Comedy Competition in 2008, Vivek has had the opportunity to take his sense of humor all over the world including Hong Kong, China, Macau, Singapore, Malaysia, Philippines, Thailand, Sri Lanka, India, Australia, Canada and USA.In 2014, the World Famous Laugh Factory in USA ranked Vivek as one of the top 10 comedians in their Annual Funniest Person in thean World Competition.In 2015, he was handpicked as one of the comedians to represent Asia’s best in Melbourne International Comedy Festival’s inaugural “Comedy Zone Asia” shows.In 2016, he was featured in Comedy Central’s first ever “Stand up Asia!” shows. One of Vivek’s passions is reading and his favorite book is Sun Tzu’s Art of War. Oddly, his favorite color is hot pink.At 42 Harsh is the newest old comedian in Hong Kong. After years of trying to be funny he recently admitted people would only laugh At him. Instantly turning him into a comedian worthy of sharing the stage with HK's best comics and even international star Paul Ogata.Vanessa Wong is an actress, living in a rom-com... but lacking the romantic part. Her picks in food are as suspicious as her picks in men.

name: Silent Inside Flow Disco

about: Put on our glowing headphones and flow to curated music over Vinyasa Practice on the rooftop of PMQ led by The Yoga Room Inside Flow instructor – Enting.Date: 26 July 2025 (Saturday)Time: 6:15-7:30pmVenue: Rooftop Garden, 4/F PMQFee: HK$200 (Class) HK$250 (Class + Mat Rental)Music and teacher instructions will be heard through wireless illuminated disco headsets.*Limited Spots OnlyLocation: PMQ, 35 Aberdeen Street, Central, HK Please arrive 15 mins before class in order to register and settle down.What to bring:> Your own yoga mat> Water> SunscreenEnquiry and Sign Up: Please drop us an email at info@yogaroomhk.com / call 2544-8398 / WhatsApp +852 6685 9097 (Click to start chat) for details.

name: Introduction to Improv Course (101) - Fall Term
location: Fringe Club, 2 Lower Albert Road Underground Theatre Hong Kong, HKI
about: OverviewWatched improv comedy and thought "I'd like to give that a try"? An actor looking to train up on ever popular improv skills? Needing help with public speaking skills? Just wanting to be comfortable not knowing what'll happen next?Whoever you are, whatever your background, if you're wanting to learn the skills of improv from the start and to be left with a solid grounding in improv, then this is the course for you.Over 8-weeks, discover - through the supportive, collaborative process we call improv performance - how to create stories, characters and ideas to captivate an audience right before their eyes. Develop those public speaking skills to allow easier and more natural dialogs with your audience. Learn how to relish the opportunity to embrace the unexpected!Topics covered by this workshopTrusting ourselves and others“Yes And”Giving and Receiving OffersSpatial and Physical Awareness/MimeCharacter WorkTeamworkReality & AuthenticityImprov scenes & gamesDates and Times:Monday evenings, 7:00pm-9:30pmSep 8, 15, 22, 29Oct 13, 20, 27Nov 3(Note: No class Oct 6)Course Fee:Earlybird*: $1,900 ($237.5/class, $95/hr)Regular: $3,000 ($375/class, $150/hr)*Earlybird pricing ends 18th AugustOur TBC Course Structure Explained:Our courses and classes have 2 defining numbers. The first number defines the level.100 series - Introductory200 series - Intermediate300 series - Advancedetc.Then the 01, 02, 03 etc. defines the type of class.101 Intro to Improv (building blocks) |102 Intro to Shortform |103 Intro to LongformWhat have our 101 students said about the series?" A part of me didn't want the 101 to finish. It was such great experience and it really helped me to explore the different area of my brain."" Thanks for the 101 it was so muchlies fun."" Really so grateful that I hopped into 101 - the learning has been great and this has been some much needed joy, silliness and connection with new pals."-----Logistics:Please arrive 5-10 minutes early - we will start on time.Wear comfortable clothes and shoes as we will stand and be active.Ages 16+. All are welcome, no previous improv experience required.Bring your own water bottle, there is no water available at the premises.Come ready to learn and hone your craft!

name: Introduction to Shortform Improv Course (102) - Fall Term
location: Fringe Club, 2 Lower Albert Road Underground Theatre Hong Kong, HKI
about: OverviewEver since the explosion of TV show "Who's Line is it Anyway?", the short-form style of improv (consisting of short scenes combining audience suggestions, improviser talents and pre-selected rules) has become synonymous with improv comedy. Though by no means the only style of improv, it is one that TBC Improv specialises in and this course will teach you the techniques behind it.Each class in the 8-week course will explore a particular genre of game: what games fall into the category, what skills they use and techniques for performing scenes within them. Become familiar with new games and reacquainted with old favourites!This course is ideally aimed at: those with some basic improv training and wishing to expand further; those who wish to specialise in short-form improv; performers with long-form background/experience wishing to become more relaxed and familiar with short-form improv.Class TopicsGeneral improv basics (refresher)Naive GamesCharacter & Scene GamesRestricted GamesMime & Physical GamesMusical & Rhyming GamesAudience Participation GamesThe Games List (or "How To Choose What To Play")Pre-requisite:Introduction to Improv (101) (or proof of equivalent)Dates and Times:Thursday evenings, 7:30-10:00pmSep 4, 11, 18, 25Oct 9, 16, 23, 30(Note: No class Oct 2)Our TBC Course Structure Explained:Our courses and classes have 2 defining numbers. The first number defines the level.100 series - Introductory200 series - Intermediate300 series - Advancedetc.Then the 01, 02, 03 etc. defines the type of class.101 Intro to Improv (building blocks) |102 Intro to Shortform |103 Intro to LongformWhat have our students said about our classes?" A part of me didn't want it to finish. It was such great experience and it really helped me to explore the different area of my brain."" Thanks for the 101 it was so muchlies fun."" Really so grateful that I hopped in - the learning has been great and this has been some much needed joy, silliness and connection with new pals."-----Logistics:Please arrive 5-10 minutes early - we will start on time.Wear comfortable clothes and shoes as we will stand and be active.Ages 16+. All are welcome, no previous improv experience required.Bring your own water bottle, there is no water available at the premises.Come ready to learn and hone your craft!

name: Virtual Reality: Versailles, Lost Gardens of the Sun King
location: 22 Museum Drive,West Kowloon Cultural District, 22 Museum Drive Units GF-01/02/03 Hong Kong, KOW
about: ABOUT THE STORYStep into 17th-Century Versailles – Through Virtual RealityExperience the forgotten heart of Versailles, where gardens once staged the grandeur of a rising empire.In this one-of-a-kind VR journey, guided by the legendary landscape architect André Le Nôtre, you’ll rediscover spaces imagined by Louis XIV as the pinnacle of royal art, power, and entertainment.🦁 The Royal Menagerie – One of Europe’s earliest zoos, filled with exotic animals gifted by foreign rulers. It once symbolized royal power and global reach.🌀 The Labyrinth Grove – A fantastical garden built for the king’s son, filled with fountains and sculptures representing Aesop’s fables.🏛️ The Grotto of Tethys – A breathtaking palace of water and light, once a symbol of royal power and artistic innovation.These gardens were designed as a living theatre — an artistic and political stage to dazzle the court and reflect the king’s absolute power. Today, they are reborn through immersive technology.

name: SHIFT Contemporary Dance Summer Intensive HK with Peter Chu (Aug 5-9)
location: 31 Wong Chuk Hang Rd, 31 Wong Chuk Hang Road Wong Chuk Hang, HKI
about: Hong Kong SHIFT Summer Intensive, August 5 - August 9 with international teaching artist Peter Chu! Peter is the Artistic Director and Founder of the contemporary company chuthis. A highly respected and sought-after artist, Peter has worked with world-renowned companies such as Ballet Jazz de Montreal, Crystal Pite's Kidd Pivot, Nederlands Dans Theater and more.Join us for a week-long immersion in contemporary dance and elevate your dancing with 30 hours of classes in: Contemporary, chuthis. ideas, Floorwork, Repertory, Contemporary Partnering, Improvisation and Creation.Peter’s class explores Qi Gong & Taichi fundamentals, modern dance principles, chuthis. repertoire and free-form/improvisational thoughts. The class encourages heightened mind/body familiarity, physical sensibility, listening and awareness guiding to the dancer to access more depth, power and emotion in their movement.💛 August 5 (Monday) - August 9 (Friday), 9AM - 4PM💛 Location: Red Shoe Dance studios, Wong Chuk Hang💛 Price: $6800 HKD (Register by April 30, 2025 for a 10% early-bird discount)💛 Ages: 13+ (Intermediate/advanced, pre-professional and professional dancers)🌏 International students welcome! We offer assistance with travel and finding accommodations. Email shiftdanceintensive@gmail.com for more information 🤗

name: Gajen Nad: Global Malaysian Chindian
location: BaseHall 2, 1 Connaught Place #15 LG/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: This show is part of the Hong Kong Comedy Season 2025In 2012, Gajen Nad took his first steps into stand-up comedy and event emceeing. After 6 years of balancing his passion with a corporate career, he made a bold move in 2018 to pursue comedy full-time.His dedication paid off when, last year, his comedy special, Professional Mixed Breed, premiered globally on Netflix, marking a major milestone as the first Penang-born comedian to achieve this.With over a decade of experience and over 1,000 events under his belt, he is known for his corporate-friendly and intelligent comedy suited for everyone!Here's what Gajen has to say about this show:"Listen, I mean read, here is my brand new 1-hour comedy special, Global Malaysian Chindian." This is a sequel to my previous special, Professional Mixed Breed, in 2022 (it's on Netflix!).In this show, I go deep into my roots and beginnings. From my Chindian childhood in the 90s, strict Indian family career expectations, engineering life, my Germany adventures, and...my niche toilet preferences.As always, the jokes are clean, culturally relatable, and perfect for locals and international friends alike! Bring your friends, dates, parents...even your ex. I promise it won’t be weird. See you soon!"This show is in English

name: Backstage Comedy Presents Elena Gabrielle Live! in Hong Kong
location: BaseHall 2, 1 Connaught Place #15 LG/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: This show is part of the Hong Kong Comedy Season 2025funny tales and unfiltered stories, Elena’s here to solve all your problems—or at least make you laugh about them! This time, she's going beyond her usual wild adventures to dive right into the audience. Yes, that means crowd work, so be ready to get involved! Elena’s blend of quick wit, hilarious storytelling, and no-holds-barred interactions will leave you wondering, “Did she just say that?” and maybe, “Am I next?” Come with questions, leave with laughs—and possibly a little scandal.About Elena Gabrielle:Elena Gabrielle’s satirical look on modern relationships teamed with her uproarious musicality has seen her stealthe show from Canada to South Africa. This Australian born European based comedian appeals to sold out audiences across the globe with her witty, no?holds barred approach to stand-up comedy and because of this, has seen her go viral with 40 million plus views on YouTube to date.Her embarrassing date stories are delivered in an intuitive storytelling style which cuts through cultural divides and is enjoyed globally. After touring non-stop for 3 years with ‘Story Party Tour’ (which saw her perform over 700 shows in that time and in over 65 countries) and sold-out runs with her 2 solo tours “DIRRTY” in 2021/22 and “Addickted” in 2023, Elena is back on tour in 2024 with her new show “OK!?.In 2021 Elena was the face of two global “Swatch” advertising campaigns and her talents are greatly sought after across Europe, even opening for the US comedian and Netflix star Iliza Schlesinger.Multi-talented, she is trained in Musical Theatre at Australia’s prestigious and premier acting University NIDA (National Institute of Dramatic Art). Elena’s singing range is also impressive; from opera to rap, she weaves her passion for song into her comedy act with musical imitations from Celine Dion to Lady Gaga. She performed in The Shuffle Show’, an epic musical adventure of 1000 songs in 1 hour which sold out shows at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe and went on to appear on TEDx.Elena also holds a Guinness world record for producing and performing in Burleskathon, 24 hours of continuous Burlesque. Elena’s tongue-in-cheek and relatable comedy repertoire blended with her sublime singing voice and risque performances have worldwide audiences side-creased, exhilarated, and thoroughly entertained.This show is in English

name: Cricut Induction Class - Maker 3 / Explore 3 智能萬用裁切機 操作班
location: Ko Fai Industrial Building, 2/F BLK B KO FAI IND BLDG,7 KO FAI ROAD YAU TONG, KOW
about: 呢個課程會教你掌握 Cricut Maker 3 / Explore 3 嘅基本操作技巧。課堂內容：Cricut Design Space (CDS) (電腦版）基本操作 筆繪和切割（CDS 範本咭制作)選用 CDS 圖片集創建範本使用「形狀」和「文字」工具設計簡單圖案，制作乙烯基貼紙圖像定位切割 (公仔貼紙）－「先印刷再切割」功能熱轉印到布製品（試用 Cricut Easypress)於上完課堂後一個月內去 Sprintec Asia Ltd 購買 Maker 3 / Explore 3 還可享有 $200 現金回贈優惠！ (此優惠不能和其他優惠同時使用。)因疫情關係，只可預約一對一教授。如需預約或有任何查詢，請用以下方式聯絡我們：電郵：support@steamaker.hk電話：2311 3189WhatsApp:  9349 4734如果你已有 Maker 3 / Explore 3, 你可以選擇網課。詳情請閱：https://www.eventbrite.hk/e/cricut-online-induction-class-maker-3-explore-3-tickets-291124359797In this class, you will learn about the basic functions of the Cricut Maker 3 / Explore 3Basic operations of Cricut Design Space (CDS) (Desktop Version)Retrieve a Draw-and-Cut project in CDS and make a cardCreate a project using image from CDS LibraryUsing  "Shapes" and "Text" tools to create a simple Vinyl projectPrint-then-cut to make a sticker Using Cricut Easypress to iron a Heat-Transfer-Vinyl design on fabricA HKD200 rebate is offered for purchasing Maker 3 / Explore 3 at Sprintec Asia Ltd.  This offer is valid within one month from the class date.  This offer cannot be used with other promotional offersDue to COVID-19, one-on-one sessions will be conducted.  For bookings or enquiries, please contact us by:Email: support@steamaker.hkCall: 2311 3189WhatsApp:  9349 4734For Maker 3 / Explore 3 owners, you may choose the online class.   For more details, please refer to:https://www.eventbrite.hk/e/cricut-online-induction-class-maker-3-explore-3-tickets-291124359797

name: Standup Comedy 102 脫口秀進修私房課 — 鄒澍老師香港首發
location: 一拳書館 Book Punch, 169-171 Tai Nan Street #3/F Kowloon, KOW
about: 你也想上台講脫口秀，卻不知從何開始？或者，你腦袋裡裝滿觀察、靈感、情緒……但總覺得少了點什麼——那個能讓全場爆笑，或讓大家靜下來專心聽你說話的「魔力」。這一次，鄒澍老師將在香港一拳書館，開設在港第一期私房脫口秀課程。四堂課，聚焦創作與現場表演的關鍵難點，幫你從「有話想說」，變成「讓人想聽」，甚至「讓人笑到拍桌」。語言不是問題：鄒澍老師主要以普通話授課，也能用英文溝通，粵語現場還有助教協助翻譯。不管你用什麼語言，都能聽得懂、學得會、講得自在。✅ 這門課適合誰？✔️ 想把生活變成段子的上班族、創作者✔️ 想在公開演說、講座中更有魅力的專業人士✔️ 剛學完 standup 101、想更進一步的你✔️ 想為自己加點「現場魅力」的任何人🎯 課程特色🔹 每節都有現場實戰練習，立即上手🔹 鄒老師現場點評風格一向直接、有趣又實用（據說學生被點評時也會笑到忘記緊張）🔹 優惠多多：這是首次在香港開班，你將成為這趟旅程的第一批核心成員📍 一拳書館 深水埗大南街169至171號 大南商業大廈 3/F全層, Kowloon, Hong Kong📆 四堂課（6月4日｜內容共鳴、6月18日｜爆點更密、7月2日｜真切演繹、7月16日｜輕鬆現場）🕢 每晚 7:30 - 9:30💰 每節 HKD 400，四堂全報只需 HKD 1280（8 折）👤 關於鄒澍老師中國大陸首個脫口秀團體「外賣脫口秀」創辦人，2007年接觸脫口秀，2009年創業入行，參與商演 1000+ 場，《Comedy Bible》主翻譯，從事專業脫口秀教學超過十年，是眾多表演者、創作者、講師背後的「老師的老師」。如果你還沒準備好上台——這門課會幫你準備好；如果你已經在創作或演講——這門課會讓你更有觀眾緣、更有感染力。無論你在哪個階段，都歡迎你來——說出你的故事，來笑，來被笑，來學會怎樣讓「笑」，成為你跟世界溝通的一種方式。

about: ✨沉浸式體驗100%日系夏夜狂熱✨暑假未飛日本嘅朋友揮揮手🤧👋🏻，我哋特登為你哋準備咗一晚限定夏日祭典😆，話到明一晚祭典，我哋玩嘅嘢一定係 #BornDifferent啦！🎏🎎今次我哋特登邀請到兩隊地下女團嚟表演 @info_lunos & @undefined.proj 👯‍♂️are you guys ready !!!!!🔥😆活動の詳細：📆：7月18日 （金）⏰：23:00-05:00📍: @atmosphere.hkg （尖沙咀）👚👕：日系 （和服bonus✨）入場方法：🎫：$200 （1 drink + 1 cheki)🎫: $270 (1 drink + 2 cheki)DM for table reservations「露比醬～嗨！何が好き？」#BornDifferent #SosocLife

name: FLUX ODYSSEY  SUMMER FLUX CAMP 2025 — ENROL NOW
location: Fringe Club, 2 Lower Albert Road Central, HKI
about: Rooted in contemporary art education and inspired by the Fluxus movement, this 4-session choice-based community art course explores drawing, collage, photography, mixed media, painting, writing and installation, through PLAY, observation, and collaboration.Children will learn:- Visual storytelling & observation- Mixed media techniques- Urban exploration & documentation- Collaboration through large-scale artand Strengthen:SpontaneityConnectionImprovisationObservationEmotional literacyImaginationSensory mappingEmpathyTactical observationCommunication🗓️ June–August, 2025📍 Fringe Club and neighbourhood, Central🎉 Culminates in a community art exhibition created by the children — a celebration of voice, creativity, shared expression and co-build the city they imagine.💝#selflove For every successful enrollment in Flux Odyssey’s Community Art Program, parents get to enjoy a FREE 90-minute treat from hershe!📩 Enrol now #linkinbio @arthaushkhttps://forms.gle/tMz2Ku73cZQWcvYN8Flux Odyssey takes inspiration from the radical ethos of the Fluxus movement, embracing experimentation, spontaneity, and collaboration. By dissolving boundaries between artist and audience, object and action, art and life, the project invites the public into an evolving space of participation—where everyday materials, language, local Hong Kong culture and gestures become powerful tools of expression.

name: Love's a Joke: Single vs Taken Comedy Battle
location: The Aftermath, 57-59 Wyndham Street #Lower G/F Central, HKI
about: Ready to laugh at love? Whether you’re single, taken, or “it’s complicated,” this is the ultimate comedy showdown for you! Watch Hong Kong’s funniest comedians go head-to-head in a hilarious battle of Single vs Taken. Who has it harder—those swiping right or those putting a ring on it? YOU, the audience, get to decide!Four pairs. Eight comedians. Each gets 5-7 minutes to roast, rant, and reveal the hilarious realities of their relationship status. At the end of the night, you’ll vote to crown which side is truly the funniest: Team Single or Team Taken.The Teams:🔥 Single Team: Caro Chan, Bing Zhu, Chad Chang, Dave Lore💍 Taken Team: Harsh Jha, Nina McGrath, Bryan Bentley, Rose RageWhen: Wednesday, July 30thTime: 8:00pm – 10:00pmWhere: The Aftermath, 57-59 Wyndham Street, CentralTickets:$250 HKD on the day$220 HKD early bird (purchase by midnight July 29)$200 HKD group early bird (for 5+, purchase by midnight July 29)Bring your squad, your date, or your “it’s complicated,” and join us for a night of big laughs, spicy jokes, and a battle where love is the punchline.Seats are limited—grab your tickets before they’re gone!

Master Workshops 大師工作坊Registration 報名: https://forms.gle/EsRSm1RsPRppfYPE9B. International Competition 國際公開賽及滙演Registration 報名: https://forms.gle/a6itxQ8KFk718YbMAC. Gala Performance 埃及民族舞表演晚會The Dance of Joy (Halawet Raqsena) is a performance at the 8th HK International Egyptian Dance Festival. This year, we are proud to be partnering with The HK Palace Museum and the Consul General of Egypt in HK to celebrate the Egyptian Ancient Antiquities Exhibition in HKPM from November 2025 to August 2026.At the Dance of Joy, National Masters of Egyptian dance and musicians and over 20 performers from around the world lead you on a mesmerizing tour of traditional, authentic Egyptian dance. With performances and music seldom experienced outside of Egypt, be prepared for an unforgettable evening.E. World Dance Gala - a celebration for culture 世界舞蹈盛會 - 文化慶典Date: 22/11/2025 (Saturday)Time: 7:30-9pmVenue: The Hong Kong Jockey Club Auditorium, Hong Kong Palace MuseumTicket Price: HK$600, 480 & 350日期：2025年11月22日（星期六）時間：19:30-21:00地點：香港故宮文化博物館 香港賽馬會演講廳票價：港幣600、480及350元For enquiries, please WhatsApp: +852 9137 5928如有查詢，歡迎WhatsApp: +852 9137 5928 See less

name: UNHEARD 2025: BODY COUNT by Philipp Henkel
location: Tomorrow Maybe, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Kowloon Hong Kong, KOW
about: BODY COUNT is a visceral and provocative exploration of the human form as both a site of trauma and resilience. Through a fusion of  performance and mixed-media installation the piece interrogates the ways bodies are quantified, commodified, and politicized—whether in war, healthcare, or systemic violence.Drawing from inspiration: forensic anthropology, memorial archives and  personal narratives, the work distorts and reconstructs the body, challenging viewers to confront the tension between individual identity and statistical anonymity. Fragmented, multiplied, or erased, the forms question: When does a body become a number? Who gets counted, and who remains invisible?With specific elements like repetitive silhouettes, raw data sonified and visualized, _Body Count_ oscillates between the intimate and the impersonal, urging a reckoning with the weight of collective loss and the fragility of corporeal existence.________Philipp Henkel is a German composer, curator, and multimedia artist based in Hannover. In his music, gestural instability and extended expressionism transform the subjective listening experience. His compositions and multimedia works explore the implications of technology and societal failure(s) through a research-led approach. In 2018 Henkel founded neuMERZ an interdisciplinary studio for research led art projects and curation in which he remains the artistic lead. Recent concerts and exhibitions of his work have taken place at GAIDA Festival in Lithuania, 21st Century Art Museum Kanazawa, Ryoguku Monten Hall Tokyo, Monopol Berlin, ZKM Karlsruhe.

name: UNHEARD 2025: Roberto Maqueda -All the times I couldn't' say goodbye...
location: Terrible Baby, Music Room, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road Hong Kong, KOW
about: All the times I couldn’t say goodbye… is a deeply personal performance project by Roberto Maqueda that transforms unspoken farewells into sound. It explores the emotional landscape of relationships that faded without closure—those moments suspended in silence and unresolved endings. Through four original compositions, the work navigates cycles of memory, doubt, and longing, while ultimately offering a fragile sense of hope. Premiered in Zürich in 2025, the piece is an attempt to sonify the unsaid and give voice to what was left behind.

name: 免費 - 航空攝影和錄像製作工作坊 (Cantonese Speaker)
location: 香港生產力大樓 - 1/F 演講廳二, 九龍塘達之路78號香港生產力促進局生產力大樓 Kowloon Tong, KOW
about: 航拍是指在飛機或其他航空飛行器上利用航空攝影機攝取地面景物的技術。過往進行航拍，您需要昂貴的器材及租用飛機或直升機於上空中進行拍攝。現在，你只需利用搖控模型飛機加上攝影機，便可輕鬆完成專業的拍攝。當然你還可以作錄像製作。利用全新器材，你可拍攝出令人心動、興奮的相片及短片、應用於不同場合包括：婚禮聚會、大型表演及開幕典禮等等。愛好攝影？愛好拍攝？立即投入全新航拍的世界。

name: UNHEARD 2025: Channelling Reduction by Simon Whetham
location: Tomorrow Maybe, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Kowloon Hong Kong, KOW
about: “Channelling” is a kinetic audiovisual project, in which a collection of motor devices salvaged from obsolete and discarded consumer technology is reanimated by environmental sound recordings. In turn, this produces new sounds from the devices, which are amplifed using various microphones and techniques.The recordings feature seemingly mundane sound phenomena that occur unpredictably and irregularly in everyday life – passing traffic, wind, doors closing – and also sounds of other machines malfunctioning. Because of this, the movement of the devices is random, variable, and autonomous. This means the relationship between performer and devices is a collaboration rather than a master and servant type situation.“Channelling Reduction” follows the trend of technology to miniaturise as it evolves, becoming smaller and lighter, but more powerful.Simon Whetham:Since 2005 Simon Whetham has worked with sonic activity as a material. He often uses environmental sound, employing a variety of methods and techniques in order to obtain often unnoticed and obscured sonic phenomena. He also explores ways of creating physical traces of sound and transforming energy forms.Whetham performs and exhibits internationally, has received a large number of commissions and awards, has many published composed works and regularly collaborates with other artists. His practice also covers giving active listening, field recording and technology repurposing workshops.

name: UNHEARD 2025: Karaoke Performances
location: Terrible Baby, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Kowloon Hong Kong, KOW

name: Hong Kong - Open Art & AOL
dateTime: Hong Kong Observation Wheel & AIA Vitality Park
location: Unit 504, 5F, Vanta Industrial Centre, 21-23 Tai Lin Pai Rd, Kwai Chung, 21-33 Tai Lin Pai Road hong kong, HKI
about: Join us for an exciting group art show, featuring top artists from around the globe!The Holy Art is proud to present a diverse range of mediums, from video art to 2D and 3D dimensional works, at our new group exhibition.The private view begins at 7:30 PM and ends at 10:00 PM on 5th December. Admission is completely free, so bring your friends and family to get the chance to come close to all the amazing talent!The exhibition is open to the public until the 7th of December 2025.Address: Unit 504, 5F, Vanta Industrial Centre, 21-23 Tai Lin Pai Rd, Kwai ChungOpening Hours:11:00 - 17:00Don't miss this unique opportunity to see some of the world's most talented artists under one roof!

name: 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair
location: Hall 5G, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre, 1  Expo Drive Wan Chai, HKI
about: Welcome to the 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair!Meet over 50 leading law firms, professional legal organisations and law schools in Hong Kong - all gathered under one roof to offer you insights, guidance, and opportunities to connect with the legal profession.This is your chance to ask questions, explore career paths, and build networks that matter.Free admission is offered to penultimate LLB, double law degree and JD students. Law students from other years are also welcome to register for free admission, but is subject to availability.Non-law and LLM students are welcome to attend with a registration fee of HKD 500, and admission is subject to a quota.Registration is required to attend, and successful registrants will receive a QR code before the event.We look forward to seeing you at Hall 5G, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre!*In the event of adverse weather conditions (e.g. T8 or above, or a Black Rainstorm Signal), the Law Fair Committee will consider rescheduling the event to Sunday, 7 September 2025, subject to venue availability. Further details will be announced if this occurs.

name: GENAI Summit
location: The Wave, 4 Hing Yip Street 10th Floor Kwun Tong, KOW
about: THE BIGGEST GENAI EVENT IN HONG KONG STARTS SOON, DONT MISS OUT香港 GenAI Summit是一項在香港舉辦的頂尖科技盛會，旨在匯聚香港本地的商界領袖與人工智能 (AI)創新者，提供一個重要的交流與合作平台，讓您深入了解及探索生成式 AI (Generative AI) 在各行各業的實際應用。The GenAI Summit is a cutting-edge event held in Hong Kong bringing together business leaders and AI Innovators in Hong Kong under one roof, the chance to explore real world applications and apply them to your business.GenAI Summit is your one-stop destination to explore the future of enterprise and consumer AI creative solutions, the place to be for Generative AI & Digital Transformations.Brilliant minds converging to explore cutting-edge advancements, from machine learning breakthroughs to real-world AI creative applications. You’ll dive into thought-provoking talks from industry leaders that inspire bold ideas, while networking sessions connect you with innovators, collaborators, and mentors in the AI space.#Artificial intelligenceWHAT TO EXPECTAI IN REAL WORLD APPLICATIONSINDUSTRY LEADERS IN GEN AIFUTURE GEN AI INNOVATIONSOfficial Website : https://www.hkgen.ai/

name: The Justice Conference Asia 2025
location: The Vine Church, 29 Burrows St Hong Kong Island
about: The Justice Conference Asia returns to Hong Kong with a renewed vision and a steadfast commitment to advancing God’s heart for justice in our city and across the region. This year’s theme, Re-Imagine, invites us to challenge our imagination, disrupt our realities, and energise our actions for practical outcomes. We invite you to join us as we explore what it means to envision a world transformed by God’s boundless vision of human flourishing and justice.

name: Summer Nights @ Shaw Auditorium: Robot Dreams
location: Main Hall, Shaw Auditorium, HKUST HONG KONG, NT
about: 逸夫演藝中心誠邀您參加盛夏電影放映活動，一同欣賞溫馨感人的動畫電影《汪汪夢裡人》。本片以狗狗與機器人之間的深厚友情為主題，透過精緻的動畫畫面與電影歌曲，細膩描繪孤獨、夢想與現實交織的情感旅程。全片無對白，但每個動作與表情都勝過千言萬語。這將是一場讓您放鬆心情、感受真摯情感的觀影體驗，誠邀您蒞臨共度美好時光！Shaw Auditorium cordially invites you to a summer film screening featuring the heartwarming animated film "Robot Dreams." This touching story showcases the profound friendship between a dog and a robot, brought to life through exquisite animation and music. With no dialogue, the film conveys deep emotions through gestures and expressions. Join us for this captivating cinematic experience that promises to soothe your mind and touch your heart!故事簡介榮獲奧斯卡最佳動畫長片提名，感動橫掃全球60+項大獎及提名，被譽為媲美《優獸大都會》及《星聲夢裡人》的年度最佳電影！單身狗狗厭倦了寂寞的獨居生活，決定購買智能機械人作伴。二人一拍即合，日夜漫遊紐約大街小巷。正當他們以為找到人生中的彼此，命運卻在一次沙灘狂歡後將他們硬生生拆散。狗狗帶著思念回復孤獨的生活日常，機械人則獨自躺在沙灘上幻想著再次回到狗狗身邊……在這場無盡的思念旅程中，有沒有一個重來的機會？SynopsisBased on a graphic novel by Sara Varon, Goya-Award-winning director Pablo Berger’s first venture into animation is a colourful, vibrant and touching buddy drama. To escape solitude, Dog assembles Robot from a build-it-yourself kit. Setting off on a whimsical exploration of New York City, the new best friends develop an inseparable bond as they savour curbside hotdogs and roller-skate through Central Park. However, their friendship is abruptly brought to a halt when an accident leaves Robot stranded on a beach.備註 Remarks:本次放映之影片不設對白。 No Dialogue.電影全長103分鐘。Film Duration: 103 minutes.電影級別: I (適合任何年齡人士觀看)。Film Classification: I (Suitable for All Ages).免費入場，請預先網上報名。 Free admission. Online registration is required.請於放映前15分鐘抵達場地。 Please arrive at the venue 15 minutes before the screening.入場守則 Admission Rules:不設劃位，先到先得。Free-seating on first-come-first-served basis.場內嚴禁飲食。No food and drinks are allowed in the venue.未經許可，請勿攝影、錄音或錄影。Unauthorized photo-taking, audio or video recording is strictly prohibited.主辦單位保留更改節目、演出者及座位安排的權利。如有任何爭議，主辦單位保留最終決定權。The organizer reserves the right to make changes to the program, performers and seating arrangement. In case of dispute, the decision of the organizer shall be final.
